info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:48PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL BERKS AND WEST CENTRAL LEHIGH COUNTIES... At 248 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wanamakers, or 13 miles southeast of Tamaqua, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Claussville and Wanamakers. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 37 and 45. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
